segment.source: Distribute apps with a management tool (Windows 10)
segment.target: Distribute apps with a management tool (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can configure a mobile device management (MDM) tool to synchronize your Store for Business inventory.
segment.target: You can configure a mobile device management (MDM) tool to synchronize your Store for Business inventory.

segment.source: Store for Business management tool services work with MDM tools to manage content.
segment.target: Store for Business management tool services work with MDM tools to manage content.

segment.source: Distribute apps with a management tool
segment.target: Distribute apps with a management tool

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: You can configure a mobile device management (MDM) tool to synchronize your Store for Business inventory.
segment.target: You can configure a mobile device management (MDM) tool to synchronize your Store for Business inventory.

segment.source: Store for Business management tool services work with MDM tools to manage content.
segment.target: Store for Business management tool services work with MDM tools to manage content.

segment.source: Your MDM tool needs to be installed and configured in Azure AD, in the same Azure AD directory used with Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Your MDM tool needs to be installed and configured in Azure AD, in the same Azure AD directory used with Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: In Azure AD management portal, find the MDM application, and then add it to your directory.
segment.target: In Azure AD management portal, find the MDM application, and then add it to your directory.

segment.source: Once the MDM has been configured in Azure AD, you can authorize the tool to work with the Store for Business.
segment.target: Once the MDM has been configured in Azure AD, you can authorize the tool to work with the Store for Business.

segment.source: This allows the MDM tool to call Store for Business management tool services.
segment.target: This allows the MDM tool to call Store for Business management tool services.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure MDM provider and Manage apps you purchased from the Windows Store for Business with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure MDM provider and Manage apps you purchased from the Windows Store for Business with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Store for Business services provide:
segment.target: Store for Business services provide:

segment.source: Services for third-party MDM tools.
segment.target: Services for third-party MDM tools.

segment.source: Synchronize app purchases and updates.
segment.target: Synchronize app purchases and updates.

segment.source: Synchronize metadata.
segment.target: Synchronize metadata.

segment.source: For offline-licensed apps, also synchronize offline app package and offline licenses.
segment.target: For offline-licensed apps, also synchronize offline app package and offline licenses.

segment.source: The ability to download offline-licensed apps from Store for Business.
segment.target: The ability to download offline-licensed apps from Store for Business.

segment.source: MDM tool requirements:
segment.target: MDM tool requirements:

segment.source: Must be an Azure Active Directory (AD) application to authenticate against the Store for Business services.
segment.target: Must be an Azure Active Directory (AD) application to authenticate against the Store for Business services.

segment.source: Must be configured in Azure AD, and Store for Business.
segment.target: Must be configured in Azure AD, and Store for Business.

segment.source: Azure AD identity is required to authorize Store for Business services.
segment.target: Azure AD identity is required to authorize Store for Business services.

segment.source: Distribute offline-licensed apps
segment.target: Distribute offline-licensed apps

segment.source: If your vendor doesn’t support the ability to synchronize applications from the management tool services or cannot connect to the management tool services, your vendor may support the ability to deploy offline licensed applications by downloading the application and license from the store and then deploying the app through your MDM.
segment.target: If your vendor doesn’t support the ability to synchronize applications from the management tool services or cannot connect to the management tool services, your vendor may support the ability to deploy offline licensed applications by downloading the application and license from the store and then deploying the app through your MDM.

segment.source: For more information on online and offline licensing with Store for Business, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: For more information on online and offline licensing with Store for Business, see Apps in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: This diagram shows how you can use a management tool to distribute offline-licensed app to employees in your organization.
segment.target: This diagram shows how you can use a management tool to distribute offline-licensed app to employees in your organization.

segment.source: Once synchronized from Store for Business, management tools can use the Windows Management framework to distribute applications to devices.
segment.target: Once synchronized from Store for Business, management tools can use the Windows Management framework to distribute applications to devices.

segment.source: Distribute online-licensed apps
segment.target: Distribute online-licensed apps

segment.source: This diagram shows how you can use a management tool to distribute an online-licensed app to employees in your organization.
segment.target: This diagram shows how you can use a management tool to distribute an online-licensed app to employees in your organization.

segment.source: Once synchronized from Store for Business, management tools use the Windows Management framework to distribute applications to devices.
segment.target: Once synchronized from Store for Business, management tools use the Windows Management framework to distribute applications to devices.

segment.source: For Online licensed applications, the management tool calls back in to Store for Business management services to assign an application prior to issuing the policy to install the application.
segment.target: For Online licensed applications, the management tool calls back in to Store for Business management services to assign an application prior to issuing the policy to install the application.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Configure MDM Provider
